description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows kernel information disclosure vulnerability (CVE-2024-38151), it is imperative to apply the relevant security updates depending on your system's version. Here’s what you need to do:

1. Identify the build number of your Windows operating system to determine the applicable update.

2. Download and install the updates from the following KB articles based on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5041592](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041592)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
   - Other updates as required based on the provided build numbers.

3. Restart your system after the installation of the updates to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update addresses a significant kernel information disclosure vulnerability that has been classified under CWE-125 (Out-of-bounds Read). It is essential to regularly update your system to protect against potential information disclosures.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure you check and confirm your system’s build number.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
